The Elder Bandhujīvaka’s Birth Story
“Pure and stainless like the moon,
clear and unclouded,🔽with delight and existence completely ended,
having crossed over the three in the world,🔽causing the people to be extinguished,
the best at crossing over the three,
the sage meditating in the forest,
one-pointed and well-concentrated.
I wreathed Bandhujīvaka flowers
with thread
and offered them to the Buddha,
Sikhī, the world’s protector.
In the twenty-ninth eon from now,
the deed I did then
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the seventh eon from now,
the lord of men, of great fame,
was named Samantacakkhu,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six super-knowledges were realized,
the Buddha’s instruction was done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bandhujīvako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai bandhujīvakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Bandhujīvaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Bandhujīvaka is the first.
